title: 10 Claude Code Alternatives for AI-Powered Coding in 2026
description: Comprehensive comparison of Claude Code alternatives including Gemini CLI, Cline, Aider, GitHub Copilot, Cursor, Replit, Windsurf, Amazon Q Developer, Continue.dev, and OpenAI Codex. Covers terminal-first, IDE-integrated, and autonomous coding assistants. Claude Code positioned as reference point for codebase-level AI tools with multi-file context and workflow capabilities.
author: DigitalOcean

title: Context Engineering for Coding Agents
description: In-depth exploration of context engineering for AI coding agents using Claude Code as primary example. Covers CLAUDE.md, Rules, Slash commands, Skills, Subagents, MCP servers, Hooks, and Plugins. Discusses emerging patterns like lazy loading context, balancing context size, and the 'illusion of control' in LLM-based tools. Context engineering defined as curating what the model sees for better results.
author: Martin Fowler (Thoughtworks)

title: The Best AI Models for Coding: Accuracy, Integration, and Developer Fit
description: JetBrains Developer Ecosystem 2025 report reveals GPT-5/GPT-5.1, Claude 3.7 Sonnet, and Gemini 2.5 Pro as top AI coding models. 85% of developers regularly use AI tools. Key selection criteria: code quality, IDE integration, cost, and data privacy. DeepSeek R1 emerging for cost-efficient local deployment. 8-step framework for choosing AI coding models based on workflow needs.
author: JetBrains AI Blog

title: AI Development Heats Up: Week of January 27 - February 2, 2026
description: Weekly AI development roundup: Claude Code and Cursor lead coding agents with enhanced multi-file editing and repository awareness. Anthropic partners with UK government for GOV.UK AI assistant. Vector databases achieve mainstream status. Model Context Protocol (MCP) gains adoption. Context engineering emerges as new discipline. Open source alternatives like Block's Goose and Continue platform gain traction.
author: Alex Merced

title: Improving 15 LLMs at Coding in One Afternoon
description: Hacker News discussion about improving LLM coding effectiveness through 'low-hanging fruit' optimizations. Community explores techniques to vastly enhance existing model performance without architectural changes.
author: Hacker News Community

title: The AI hater's guide to code with LLMs
description: Hacker News discussion with ironic title exploring approaches for AI skeptics to effectively use LLMs for coding. Community shares practical perspectives on embracing AI assistance despite skepticism.
author: Hacker News Community

title: Stop generating, start thinking
description: Hacker News discussion on the role of AI and LLMs in programming. Explores how programmers use AI for solutions and bug detection, questioning whether AI represents the future of programming assistance.
author: Hacker News Community

title: DockSmith: Scaling Reliable Coding Environments via an Agentic Docker Builder
description: Paper introducing DockSmith, an agentic Docker builder for scaling reliable coding environments. Addresses challenges in creating reproducible development environments at scale using AI agents. Relevant for DevOps and platform engineering teams.
author: Jiaran Zhang, Luck Ma, Yanhao Li, et al.

title: PCBSchemaGen: Constraint-Guided Schematic Design via LLM for Printed Circuit Boards
description: Research on using LLMs for constraint-guided PCB schematic design, demonstrating AI's expanding role in hardware design and engineering workflows beyond software development.
author: Huanghaohe Zou, Peng Han, Emad Nazerian, Alex Q. Huang

title: Engineering AI Agents for Clinical Workflows: Architecture, MLOps, and Governance
description: Case study on engineering AI agents for clinical workflows, covering architecture design, MLOps practices, and governance considerations for AI in healthcare environments. Accepted for IEEE/ACM International Conference on AI Engineering 2026.
author: Cláudio Lúcio do Val Lopes, João Marcus Pitta, Fabiano Belém, et al.

title: Gated Subspace Steering for Selective Memorization Mitigation
description: Research on mitigating selective memorization in ML models using gated subspace steering, relevant for improving LLM reliability and reducing training data leakage. Addresses privacy and robustness concerns in deployed models.
author: Researchers from University of British Columbia, Vector Institute

title: From Gameplay Traces to Game Mechanics: Causal Induction with Large Language Models
description: Research on using LLMs for causal induction from gameplay traces to infer game mechanics, demonstrating applications in game development and AI reasoning. Submitted to ICPR 2026.
author: Mohit Jiwatode, Alexander Dockhorn, Bodo Rosenhahn

title: Localizing and Correcting Errors for LLM-based Planners
description: Research on error localization and correction techniques for LLM-based planning systems, improving reliability of agentic AI workflows. Addresses key challenge in autonomous agent development.
author: Aditya Kumar, William W. Cohen

title: Position: Agentic Evolution is the Path to Evolving LLMs
description: Position paper arguing that agentic evolution represents the path forward for evolving LLM capabilities, discussing implications for future AI development. Explores how agent-based approaches may lead to more advanced AI systems.
author: Minhua Lin, Hanqing Lu, Zhan Shi, et al.

title: SayNext-Bench: Why Do LLMs Struggle with Next-Utterance Prediction?
description: Introduction of SayNext-Bench, a benchmark for evaluating LLM performance on next-utterance prediction tasks, analyzing challenges in conversational AI and understanding dialogue context.
author: Yueyi Yang, Haotian Liu, Fang Kang, et al.
